alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 10:19PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Arizona, including the following county, Gila. * WHEN...Until 415 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM MST, gauge reports on San Carlos River are rising quickly downstream from Elgo Dam and water is beginning to spill over Elgo Dam. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Carlos and Peridot. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
